results.title: Great Railways Flying Scotsman
results.brief_description: Steam Locomotives are seen alive and well in the vast expanses of the Indian subcontinent where these engines are still a key component in modern Indian commerce. This film focuses on two locomotive personalities from the history of steam: the 4472 “Flying Scotsman” on its last non-stop London to Edinburgh run, and an impressive 1/8th scale model of the largest steam locomotive ever built, the Union Pacific “Big Boy”. Rated: G

results.title: Great railway journeys. Series 4. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Mike Wadding, Nicola Bolton and Brith Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Part 1: Los Mochis to Veracruz . Chef Rick Stein takes a look at his points of interest on the train and along the track during the trip through the Sierra Madre Mountains in Mexico. Part 2: Singapore to Bangkok. Stephen Tompkinson’s (TV’s ‘Ballykissangel’) love for trains came from being born in an old English railway town. He takes a look at the Singapore mass transit system prior to his trip on the Eastern and Oriental Express. On the way he visits cities and looks at the local people and their cultures.

results.title: Great piggy-bank raid: Honesty
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
Presents the Forest Town puppet friends in an adventure in which they learn a lesson in honesty when they try to raise enough money to buy uniforms for their band concert.

results.title: Great Pas de deux
results.brief_description: This superb collection of stunning pas de deux, from many of the best loved classical ballets, features some of the most celebrated partnerships of recent times from companies such as The Royal Ballet, The Kirov Ballet, The Bolshoi Ballet, American Ballet Theatre and Adventures in Motion Pictures. Individual pieces and their performers include: Maria Bylova and Leonid Nikonov in ‘Spring Waters’, Margot Fonteyn and Rudolf Nureyev in ‘Le Corsaire’, Darcey Bussell and Jonathan Cope in ‘The Prince of the pagodas’, Adam Cooper and Scott Ambler in ‘Swan Lake’, Alessandra Ferri and Wayne Eagling in ‘Romeo and Juliet’, Lesley Collier and Anthony Dowell in ‘The Nutcracker’, ‘Jennifer Penney and Anthony Dowell in ‘Manon’, Yulia Makhalina and Igor Zelensky in ‘Swan Lake’, Natalia Makarova and Anthony Dowell in ‘A Month in the country’, Natalya Bessmertnova and Irek Mukhamedov in ‘Spartucus’, Irina Kolpakova and Sergei Berezhnoi in ‘The Sleeping beauty’, and Cynthia Harvey and Mikhail Baryshnikov in ‘Don Quixote’.

results.title: Great National Parks of Australia
results.creator_credit: Eddie Moses, John Richardson, Film Australia and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: Australia has some of the most spectacular and diverse parks in the world. This documentary explores six, capturing the beauty, history and man’s impact on the area. The parks featured are: Daintree National Park, Great Barrier Reef, Kosciusko National Park, Western Tasmania, Kakadu National Park, Uluru National Park. This journey into the most treasured areas of Australia’s heritage draws the viewer into a fascinating exploration of the relationship between landscape and the indigenous animals, local mythology, and turbulent political and social history of each park.

results.title: Great myths & legends (PC)
results.creator_credit: Christophe Pascal, Christophe Queant, EMME Interactive and Nexus Interactions
results.brief_description: This 2 CD ROM set covers monsters and mythical creatures, legendary lands and lost cities. Volume 1 covers the yeti, minotaur, Loch Ness Monster, cyclops, leviathan, pegasus, golem, unicorn, gorgon and phoenix. Volume 2 covers the lands and lost cities of Atlantis, Tower of Babel, Easter Island, Eldorado, Bermuda Triangle, Labryinth of Daedalus, Stonehenge, Herod’s Temple, Garden of Eden and the Fountain of Youth.

results.title: Great Lakes: Highway to commerce
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Depicts the importance of the Great Lakes to the early settlements of America and to the industrial development of regions adjacent to them, Illustrates the role of the Lakes in transporting lumber, wheat, coal, and iron ore; and pictures typical fright carrying vessels. Emphasizes the significance of the Lakes to the prosperity of America and to the well being of her people.

results.title: Great Lakes
results.brief_description: A vast stream of shipping, with millions of tons of varying cargo, moves through the canals and locks of the Great Lakes, passing through the centre of the Canadian Continent. The film shows the booming industrial life of the Great Lakes region - steel production, pulp manufacture, ship-building, grain storage, and the workings of the great lock and canal systems.

results.title: Great Grandmother
results.creator_credit: Lorna Rasmussen, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film presents four women, still living, who represent the social position of women in the early wast. Their stores are combined with stills, archival footage, material from publications of the time, diaries, and personal papers. The film was shot in some of the ‘living museums’ of Alberta.
